segments.script:
The women of New Vegas ask me a lot if there's a Mrs. New Vegas. Well, of course there is. You're her.

I heard tell from a well-placed source that the old Ranger Unification Monument out at Mojave Outpost might be in peril. Word is, some radical NCR folks are calling for it to be torn down as a symbol of "collaboration" with the Desert Rangers. Can you dig it? I mean, sure, times change and alliances shift, but that monument represents an important chapter in our history here in the Mojave.

Someone told me the NCR's been having some internal debates about how much they should integrate with the independent settlements in the Wasteland. On one hand, they want to bring everyone under their protection umbrella. But on the other, they're afraid of losing their identity as a unified nation if they absorb too many different cultures.

You know, it's always a delicate dance between unity and individuality out here in the wilds. I hope cooler heads prevail when it comes to the monument - we could lose an important piece of our heritage if that happens. But hey, maybe I'm just romanticizing the past a bit. What do you think, my dear? Do share your insights with me...

segments.script:
The women of New Vegas ask me a lot if there's a Mrs. New Vegas. Well, of course there is. You're her.

I've been hearing some curious rumors lately that I just can't help but share with my lovely listeners! Someone told me the folks up in Primm have spotted strange, robed figures lurking around at night. Could be those fanatics from the Legion on a reconnaissance mission, or maybe just some desert rats looking for an easy score.

Word is also circulating about an underground movement stirring up trouble in the NCR camps near Goodsprings. Apparently, they're advocating for independence and don't take kindly to the NCR's rule. Nothing too out of the ordinary for these parts, but it does make for some juicy gossip!

That's all for now, my sweethearts. Just remember: you might be nobody 'til somebody loves you, but I'm that somebody. Now go on, live life on your own terms and dig those Mojave sunsets! This is Mr. New Vegas, signing off from Radio Appalachia. Until next time... stay lovely!

segments.script:
The women of New Vegas ask me a lot if there's a Mrs. New Vegas. Well, of course there is. You're her.

I heard from some cats that dig the wasteland scene, word is the NCR and Desert Rangers aren't as chummy as they used to be out at Mojave Outpost. Quote, unquote, tensions have been rising between 'em since those Legion raids. Some say it's 'cause the NCR's been getting a bit too big for its britches, if you catch my drift.

But others claim the Desert Rangers are just feeling a mite...restless, like they're itching to get back out there and start causing some trouble again on their own terms. I mean, can't really blame 'em, if it's true. We've all been there, right? Feeling cooped up in one place for too long.

Still, let's hope these rumors ain't true, or we might see some real fireworks brewin' at that old monument. Wouldn't want any trouble to break out between our boys and girls in blue...and gray! Sooner we get the whole Mojave Wasteland united under one banner again, the better off we'll all be. But hey, that's just my two caps on the matter. What do you think, Mrs. New Vegas? Care to share your insight?
